info.description:
# PayMaya Payment Gateway - Checkout

## API Authentication
Authentication is done via HTTP Basic Authentication. Depending on the API, the public / secret key must be provided as the username and the password left as blank.

Steps are as follows:
1.  Combine Username and Password (left blank) separated by ‘:’ (colon). If your API key is “pk-Z0OSzLvIcOI2UIvDhdTGVVfRSSeiGStnceqwUE7n0Ah”, the resulting string is:

```no-highlight
pk-Z0OSzLvIcOI2UIvDhdTGVVfRSSeiGStnceqwUE7n0Ah:
```

2.  Apply Base64 encoding to the resulting string from Step 1. Using the resulting string from Step 1, the Base64 encoded string will be:

```no-highlight
cGstWjBPU3pMdkljT0kyVUl2RGhkVEdWVmZSU1NlaUdTdG5jZXF3VUU3bjBBaDo=
```

3.  Indicate the authorization method i.e. “Basic” followed by a space then the Base64 encoded string in Step 2. An example is shown below.

```no-highlight
Authorization: Basic cGstWjBPU3pMdkljT0kyVUl2RGhkVEdWVmZSU1NlaUdTdG5jZXF3VUU3bjBBaDo=
```

(see [HTTP Basic Auth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic_access_authentication))

## Environment Setup
PayMaya Payment Gateway has two environments:
**Sandbox** and **Production**.

**Sandbox** is used for development, testing and integration. Once integration is completed on this environment it will be verified by our Merchant Services team. Only then will production credentials be provided. 
##### Sandbox Url: https://pg-sandbox.paymaya.com

> Load testing is not allowed on both environments. If you have need for load testing please contact us.

**Production** is for live payments. Testing in this environment will incur real charges
##### Production Url: https://pg.paymaya.com

## Checkout

Checkout is a full page redirect payment acceptance. The checkout page can host more than one payment method in just one API call.

### Payment Flow
```mermaid
sequenceDiagram
Customer ->> Merchant: Initiate Payment

Merchant ->> Payment Gateway: Create Payment
Payment Gateway -->> Merchant: Return redirectUrl

Merchant -->> Customer: Redirect to webpage
Customer ->> Payment Gateway: Customer completes authentication
Payment Gateway -->> Customer: Show status page

alt Payment Confirmation
    Customer ->> Merchant: Redirect back to Merchant
    Merchant ->> Payment Gateway: Get Payment
    Payment Gateway -->> Merchant: Returns
else
    Payment Gateway ->> Merchant: Sends Webhook
end
```

### Payment Statuses
```mermaid
graph TD
subgraph Create 
    PT(PENDING_TOKEN)
    PP(PENDING_PAYMENT)
end
subgraph Authentication 
    FA(FOR_AUTHENTICATION)
    AA(AUTHENTICATING)
    AS(AUTH_SUCCESS)
    AF(AUTH_FAILED)
end
subgraph Processing 
    P(PAYMENT_PROCESSING)
    PS(PAYMENT_SUCCESS)
    PF(PAYMENT_FAILED)
end
subgraph After Sales
    VD(VOIDED)
    RF(REFUNDED)
end
PE(PAYMENT_EXPIRED)
PT --> PE
PP --> PE
FA --> PE
AA --> PE
PT --> PP
PP --> FA
FA --> AA
AA --> AS
AA --> AF
AS --> P
P --> PS
P --> PF
PS --> VD
PS --> RF
```
> Payments expire 1 hour from Creation and 15 mins from Authentication start.

**Authentication varies on the payment method used.**
* Authentication for Card payments is done via 3D Secure. Customers are redirected to the card networks and/or the issuers web pages for authentication. Authentication challenges may vary per issuing bank.
* Authentication for Pay With PayMaya is done via PayMaya login and one-time pin challenge.

## Webhooks

The PayMaya Payment Gateway supports webhooks. A webhook (also called a web callback) is a way for an application to provide other applications with real-time information. With webhooks, PayMaya sends out payment-related information to the Merchant’s set of provided URLs for internal processing/audit.
> The webhook will be triggered with an HTTP POST request with the content body equivalent to the Get Checkout API

> Webhooks are environment specific. They must be registered again on Production.

The table below lists down the webhook names for PayMaya wallet payments listed according to the status of the payment transaction:

|Webhook name|Payment status
|-|-
|CHECKOUT_SUCCESS|PAYMENT_SUCCESS
|CHECKOUT_FAILURE|PAYMENT_FAILED
|CHECKOUT_DROPOUT|PAYMENT_EXPIRED

You may register your webhook endpoints thru the Settings page on PayMaya Manager or via the Webhook APIs listed in this document.

For more details refer to the Webhook Guide and FAQ [here](https://hackmd.io/@paymaya-pg/WebhookFAQ)

## Customizations

The PayMaya Payment Gateway supports customizations on select UI components. The following are the supported customizations:

> Customizations are environment specific. They must be configured again on Production.

|Customization Name|Parameter Name|Value|Description
|-|-|-|-
|Logo Url|logoUrl|Publicly accessible link to an image|Merchant logo to be displayed, Max height is 50px
|Icon Url|iconUrl|Publicly accessible link to an image|Favicon. This is the small icon on the top of the browser page.
|Apple Touch Icon Url|appleTouchIconUrl| Publicly accessible link to an image|Favicon* for Apple Touch, 120px x 120px image
|Custom Title|customTitle|String|Changes the page title
|Color Scheme|colorScheme|Hex color code|Changes the button color
|Show Merchant Name|showMerchantName|true/false|Hides the Merchant Name underneath the logo. Use this if your logo already has your brand name
|Hide Receipt|hideReceiptInput|true/false|Hides the online receipt sending panel on the result page
|Redirect Timer|redirectTimer|Number between 3-30|Time in seconds before auto redirection on the result page
|Skip Result Page|skipResultPage|true/false|If set to true will not display the PayMaya result page. After processing it will redirect back to the Merchant website.

> Customizations only need to be setup once and not before every Checkout

You may register your customizations thru the Settings page on PayMaya Manager or via the APIs listed below

tags.description:
Cancel a pending transaction.

## Cancel Payment Status

```mermaid
graph TD
PENDING_TOKEN --> PAYMENT_CANCELLED
PENDING_TOKEN --> PENDING_PAYMENT
PENDING_PAYMENT --> PAYMENT_CANCELLED
```

## Cancel Payment Webhooks

`PAYMENT_CANCELLED` All cancelled payments will fire the `PAYMENT_CANCELLED` webhook.

`CHECKOUT_CANCELLED` If the transaction cancelled is a Checkout transaction, it will fire the `CHECKOUT_CANCELLED` webhook. If you have a `PAYMENT_CANCELLED` webhook registered, it will also be fired.

post.description:
Creates a checkout transaction.

> **For Kount Merchants**:
If you require the customer to enter its full details on the checkout page,
the buyer information may be **optionally** provided in the request body of the API.

totalAmount.title: Total Amount
totalAmount.description: Contains the value and currency of the transaction.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description:
Contains personal information regarding the buyer/payer of the transaction. By default, all information are optional (i.e. use `Basic Buyer` specification).
However, If the merchant is enabled to use Kount fraud protection, they must use `Kount Buyer` specification.

allOf.title: Buyer
allOf.description: Contains personal information regarding the buyer/payer of the transaction.

customerSince.description: Date in [ISO 8601 / RFC 3339 full-date format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6) when payer/buyer registered as a customer as per merchant's records.

contact.title: Contact Details
contact.description: Contact details like phone and/or email address.

billingAddress.title: Billing Address
billingAddress.description:
Contains billing information of the payer/buyer. By default, all information are optional (i.e. use `Basic Billing Address` specification).
However, If the merchant is enabled to use Kount fraud protection, they must use `Kount Billing Address` specification.

shippingAddress.title: Shipping Address
shippingAddress.description:
Contains shipment information including name of the person identified to receive the purchase order. By default, all information are optional (i.e. use `Basic Shipping Address` specification).
However, If the merchant is enabled to use Kount fraud protection, they must use `Kount Shipping Address` specification.

oneOf.title: Basic Shipping Address
oneOf.description: Contains shipment information including name of the person identified to receive the purchase order.

oneOf.title: Kount Shipping Address
oneOf.description: Contains shipment information including name of the person identified to receive the purchase order.

allOf.description: Contains personal information regarding the buyer/payer of the transaction.

firstName.description: The first name of the PayMaya account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the PayMaya account holder.

msisdn.description: The mobile phone number (MSISDN) associated to the PayMaya account.

email.description: The mobile phone number (MSISDN) associated to the PayMaya account.

masked.description: The masked mobile phone number, which *may* show the last 4 digits.

traceNumber.title: Terminal Trace Number

emvIccData.title: EMV ICC Data
emvIccData.description: EMV ICC binary data returned by the Issuer. To be used for post-processing (e.g., Issuer Authentication by EMV EXTERNAL AUTHENTICATE or 2nd GENERATE AC).

receipt.title: Processor Receipt
receipt.description: Additional transaction reference numbers generated by either the issuing bank or the acquiring host. This is only relevant for card and PayMaya Account payments.

transactionId.title: Transaction ID
transactionId.description: Unique identifier returned by the issuer for this transaction.

approvalCode.title: Approval Code
approvalCode.description: Approval Code / Authorization Identification Code generated by the issuer to indicate the approval of a transaction

batchNo.title: Processor Batch Number
batchNo.description: Value supplied by P3 or the value of `transaction.trace.batchNo` during the request (if supplied) which indicates the batch of transactions that the specific transaction has been grouped with. Merchants may keep track of this value for reconnaissance.

traceNo.title: Processor Trace Number
traceNo.description: Value of `transaction.trace.traceNo` during the request (if supplied)

receiptNo.title: Receipt Number
receiptNo.description: A receipt / reference number generated by the acquirer. Can be used by all parties (cardholder merchant payment gateway acquirer issuer) when looking up a specific transaction record for reconnaisance.

approvalCode.title: Approval Code
approvalCode.description: Approval Code / Authorization Identification Code generated by the issuer to indicate the approval of a transaction

receiptNumber.title: Receipt Number
receiptNumber.description: A receipt / reference number generated by the acquirer. Can be used by all parties (cardholder merchant payment gateway acquirer issuer) when looking up a specific transaction record for reconnaisance.

authorizationType.title: Authorization Type
authorizationType.description: For card transactions, it indicates the type of authorization applied. For more information, click this [link](https://cdn.paymaya.com/sandbox/payments_api/paymayap3/paymayap3.html#header-authorization-types).

capturedAmount.description: Indicates the total amount already captured for this authorization payment. Only applicable if the transaction has an `authorizationType`.

authorizationPayment.title: Authorization Payment ID
authorizationPayment.description: The unique identification of the authorization payment associated to this payment. Only applicable if this is a capture payment.

capturedPaymentId.title: Capture Payment ID
capturedPaymentId.description: The unique identification of the capture payment associated to this payment. Only applicable if this is an authorization payments.

subscription.title: Subscription ID
subscription.description: The unique identification of the subscription associated to this payment.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Used to provide additional data to the transaction such a payment faciliator information.

subMerchantRequestReferenceNumber.title: Sub-merchant Request Reference Number
subMerchantRequestReferenceNumber.description: Reference number of the sub-merchant for the related transaction

pf.title: Payment Facilitator

state.description: Sub-merchant state location in full text.

post.description: Provides customization settings for the merchant to change some elements on the user interface.

logoUrl.description: URL that points to the merchant's logo image.

iconUrl.description: URL that points to the merchant's icon image.

appleTouchIconUrl.description: URL that points to the merchant's Apple icon image.

customTitle.description: Customized title used in the web browser.

colorScheme.description: The HEX color code that is used for the payment button.

hideReceiptInput.description: Indicates if the merchant does not allow its payers to freely send transaction receipts (i.e. set to `true`).

skipResultPage.description:
Indicates if the merchant does not want to show the payment result page.
When skipped (i.e. set to `true`), the payment page redirects immediately to the merchant's redirect URL.

showMerchantName.description:
Indicates if the merchant name on the result page is displayed.
For merchants that have their name in their logo, they may opt to hide a textual display of their name to remove duplicity.

redirectTimer.description:
The number of seconds the payment result page is shown before it redirects to the merchant's redirect URL.

The following are the **default** time used depending on the resulting payment:
- `15 seconds`: for successful payments
- `5 seconds`: for failed payments

publicKey.description:
Merchant keys that are used to access public endpoints. These endpoints are normally triggered from the merchant's frontend system,
and as such the keys are safe to be loaded on the frontend apps.

secretKey.description:
Merchant keys that are used to access secret endpoints. These endpoints are normally triggered from the merchant's backend system,
and should not be loaded on the frontend apps and/or distributed in public.

message.description: Additional description on the error encountered.

parameters.description: This property is only relevant for validation errors.

field.description: The parameter name that is missing or invalid.

description.description: Additional information on why the error occurred.

colorScheme.description: The HEX color code that is used for the payment button.

hideReceiptInput.description: Indicates if the merchant does not allow its payers to freely send transaction receipts (i.e. set to `true`).

skipResultPage.description:
Indicates if the merchant does not want to show the payment result page.
When skipped (i.e. set to `true`), the payment page redirects immediately to the merchant's redirect URL.

showMerchantName.description:
Indicates if the merchant name on the result page is displayed.
For merchants that have their name in their logo, they may opt to hide a textual display of their name to remove duplicity.

redirectTimer.description:
The number of seconds the payment result page is shown before it redirects to the merchant's redirect URL.

The following are the **default** time used depending on the resulting payment:
- `15 seconds`: for successful payments
- `5 seconds`: for failed payments
